sense.name: to give compensation for something, either through money or some other form
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] PAY NP2 Includes: PAY BACK, PAY CASH, PAY DOWN, PAY FOR, PAY OFF, PAY UP
sense.examples: I paid four dollars for this sandwich. Does she pay you for the work you are doing? He paid for his fun last night with a terrible hangover this morning. He always pays his credit card monthly bill on time. Please pay the fine for these overdue library books. She paid the fireman who rescued her with a smile. You still need to pay me back that 10 dollars. I paid cash for this sweater. Mark paid off the mobsters for his safety. Businesses are paying out more each year for health insurance. If he doesn't pay up soon, the IRS will repossess his car.

sense.name: give cognizance to something or someone
sense.examples: Don't pay them any mind, they mean no harm. Please pay special attention to how you pack those. Pay heed to street signs or you'll get a ticket.

sense.name: be worth something, yield a result
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 PAY NP2[recipient] Includes: PAY OFF
sense.examples: How much does this savings certificate pay annually? It definitely pays to get a college degree. It didn't pay to remodel the family room before we sold the house.

sense.name: make, undertake
sense.examples: He always pays a visit to his parents at Thanksgiving. She paid me a call at work last week.
